text:
üá≥üá¨ NIGERIA SCHOOL KIDNAPPING FAR WORSE THAN FIRST REPORTED - 303 CHILDREN MISSING

Armed gunmen abducted 303 schoolchildren and 12 teachers from St. Mary's School in Nigeria's Niger state, the Christian Association confirmed today after recounting.

The original tally of 215 missed 88 students who were captured while trying to escape.

This happened four days after 25 kids were kidnapped from a school 106 miles away in neighboring Kebbi state. No one has claimed responsibility yet.

School kidnappings have become a defining feature of insecurity in Africa's most populous nation. Armed gangs view schools as strategic targets for maximum attention.

UNICEF reported last year that only 37% of schools in conflict zones have early warning systems.

Authorities deployed tactical squads and local hunters for rescue efforts.

Source: AP News

quote.text:
üá≥üá¨ ANOTHER CHRISTIAN SCHOOL RAIDED IN NIGERIA - 52 CHILDREN ABDUCTED

Armed men stormed a Catholic school in Niger State, abducting dozens of children and staff, just days after 25 girls were taken from a school in nearby Kebbi.

Local reports say 52 kids are missing.

Authorities had intelligence this could happen. It happened anyway.

How many more schools need to be hit before someone actually stops this?

Source: Associated Press

text:
Nigeria: Islamists stormed a Catholic school overnight, kidnapping more than 50 children.

Dozens of armed jihadists arrived on motorbikes to assault St. Mary‚Äôs School in Papiri, Niger State.

The attack follows a similar incident on Monday in Kebbi State, where 25 schoolgirls were kidnapped.

We denounce this evil.

May those responsible be found and dealt with decisively.

Pray for the safety of these kiddos and their immediate return to their families.
